TEXT.TITLE: U.S. HOUSE DEMOCRAT, GOP BUDGET WRITERS MEET
TEXT.BODY: In a step that could lead to a breakthrough in the drafting of next year's federal budget, Democratic and Republican members of the House Budget Committee met behind closed doors to explore the possibility of a bipartisan budget, lawmakers said. No conclusions were reached on whether the two sides would be able to get together on a budget outline, the lawmakers said. After the meeting broke up, panel Democrats reconvened behind closed doors for further talks. Reuter
